docs.snippet: A Cambridge Analytica whistleblower said on Tuesday that Canadian company AggregateIQ worked on software called Ripon which was used to identify Republican voters ahead of the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

headline.print_headline: Whistleblower Says Canadian Company Worked on Software to Find Republican Voters
headline.main: Whistleblower Says Canadian Company Worked on Software to Find Republican Voters

docs.snippet: Facebook's CEO apologized for the Cambridge Analytica scandal with ads in multiple U.S. and British newspapers Sunday, saying the social media platform doesn't deserve to hold personal information if it can't protect it.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Ads Apologize for Cambridge Analytica Scandal
headline.main: Facebook Ads Apologize for Cambridge Analytica Scandal

docs.snippet: The St. Mary’s County Sheriff’s Office said Austin Wyatt Rollins fatally shot himself in the head at the same time an officer fired at him.

headline.print_headline: Maryland School Gunman Confronted by Officer Shot Himself, Authorities Say
